intro: Atylosia major, commonly known as the showy blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features narrow, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Atylosia major typically grows in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its foliage consists of linear, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
